data.title: Population of animals
data.solution:
m = int(input())
n = int(input())
t = int(input())

num_0y = 0
num_1y = 0
num_old = n
for year in range(t):
    num_old += num_1y
    num_1y = num_0y
    num_0y = num_old * m
print(num_0y + num_1y + num_old)
data.statement:
A particular animal reproduces to give [[m]] offspring per year per animal, however, they can only start reproducing once they are {{2}} years old (e.g. if born in year 0, can add to population in year 2). No animals die for any reasons, and the initial animals are all of sufficient age to reproduce.

If there are [[n]] of these animals at the start, ouput how many animals there will be after [[t]] years.
data.stubGenerator:
read m:int
read n:int
read t:int
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> Integer [[m]] of how many offspring each animal will produce per year.
<<Line 2:>> Integer [[n]] of how many animals there are at the start.
<<Line 3:>> Integer [[t]] of how many years will pass.
data.outputDescription: An integer of how many animals (of any age) are present after all time has passed.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

A particular animal reproduces to give m offspring per year per animal, however, they can only start reproducing once they are 2 years old (e.g. if born in year 0, can add to population in year 2). No animals die for any reasons, and the initial animals are all of sufficient age to reproduce.

If there are n of these animals at the start, ouput how many animals there will be after t years.
Input
Line 1: Integer m of how many offspring each animal will produce per year.
Line 2: Integer n of how many animals there are at the start.
Line 3: Integer t of how many years will pass.
Output
An integer of how many animals (of any age) are present after all time has passed.
Constraints
0 ≤ m ≤ 10
0 ≤ n ≤ 10
0 ≤ t ≤ 10
Example
Input
3
2
2
Output
14
